headline: Is Lucid Group a Millionaire-Maker Stock?
summary: Despite Lucid's award-winning cars, its stock has plunged 96% from its peak.  When Lucid Group (NASDAQ: LCID) went public in 2021, many investors hoped it would be the next Tesla.  Today, those early believers have watched their investments plummet 96% from the stock's peak.

headline: Inflation data, big bank earnings, and Netflix results: What to watch this week
summary: A busy week ahead for investors will see inflation data, the debate about the Fed's next move, and the start of second quarter earnings season all come into focus after a flurry of trade activity last week.

headline: Why Musk may be running out of road at Tesla
summary: One way to antagonise Elon Musk is to mention that he did not found Tesla. The electric car maker was incorporated by Martin Eberhard and Marc Tarpenning in 2003, a year before Musk led an investment in the company.

raw.headline: Why Musk may be running out of road at Tesla
raw.summary: One way to antagonise Elon Musk is to mention that he did not found Tesla. The electric car maker was incorporated by Martin Eberhard and Marc Tarpenning in 2003, a year before Musk led an investment in the company.

headline: Elon Musk Is Back at Work and Burning Through Executives
summary: The sun is shining bright again in the  Elon Musk  business empire.  “Thank you for your contributions,” Musk—who has a way with goodbyes—told his outgoing chief executive at X,  Linda Yaccarino,  on Wednesday.  Just days earlier, it was revealed that Omead Afshar, who was heading sales and manufacturing for  Tesla  in North America and Europe, had left Musk’s electric-car company.

headline: New tax break for auto loans could save some buyers thousands of dollars. But will it boost sales?
summary: Millions of people receive a federal tax deduction for the interest they pay on home loans.  Under President Donald Trump’s new tax-cut law, many people for the first time also could claim a tax deduction for interest on their vehicle loans.  The new tax break will be available even to people who don't itemize deductions.

raw.headline: New tax break for auto loans could save some buyers thousands of dollars. But will it boost sales?

The new tax break will be available even to people who don't itemize deductions.

headline: The Best EV Deals Now Are on the Used Market
summary: Used electric vehicle sales topped 100,000 in the second quarter—a milestone amid tepid demand for new electric vehicles and the approaching end to federal tax credits.

headline: Xi’s Price-War Campaign Creates a Buzz in China’s Stock Market
summary: (Bloomberg) -- For strategists at JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Goldman Sachs Group Inc. as well as money managers in Hong Kong and Singapore, an opaque term has suddenly emerged as the catchphrase for deciphering Chinese policy intentions and navigating the stock market.Most Read from BloombergSinger Akon’s Failed Futuristic City in Senegal Ends Up a $1 Billion ResortWhy Did Cars Get So Hard to See Out Of?How German Cities Are Rethinking Women’s Safety — With TaxisPhiladelphia Trash Piles Up as Garb
